intro: Parnassia palustris subsp. neogaea, commonly known as the swamp parnassia, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its distinctive white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in wetlands and bogs. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating. It is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
